newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Nigeria-bound oil leaving Ivory Coast as normal.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria-bound oil leaving Ivory Coast as normal.

text.p: Refined crude oil shipments from Ivory Coast destined for oil-strapped Nigeria are continuing in line with existing contracts, an Ivorian oil official said on Tuesday.

"Put it this way. Nigeria is one of our habitual clients. If we had contracts in place they will be met," a manager for Ivory Coast's state refining company, Societe Ivoirienne de Raffinage told Reuters. "We buy Nigerian oil and sell it through traders and afterwards they trade without a destination clause."

Nigeria said on Tuesday that 33 cargoes of oil products would arrive in the country between now and Sunday to end an acute fuel scarcity that has plagued Africa's leading oil producing nation for the past five weeks.
"The cargoes will come from Europe, especially Spain as well as other African countries," a Nigerian Pipelines and Products Marketing Company (PPMC) official told Reuters in Lagos.
The SIR spokesman, who chose not to be named, said annual exports of refined Nigerian crude oil back to Nigeria totalled about 300-400,000 tonnes.
Shipping inspectors declined to comment on oil shipment schedules but said an official ban by Nigeria on imports of refined products was technically in place.
Ivorian officials said oil exports to Nigeria were mostly arranged through international oil majors.
